availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Pennsylvania,
City and County of Philadelphia, SS.:

I, Hugh M. Tener, residing in the city of Philadelphia, in the state of Pennsylvania, appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky, a commissioner in and for the State of Pennsylvania, under Chapter 70 of the Act of the General Assembly of said State of Kentucky, entitled "An act to adopt the Revised Statutes" approved January 7th, 1852, do solemnly swear that I will well and truly execute and perform all the duties of such commissioner, and by virtue of the laws of the said State of Kentucky, and that the following is an impression of my seal of office.

figure.ab:
HUGH W. TENER
COMMISSIONER OF DEEDS.
PHILADELPHIA
PENNA:

body.p: Taken and subscribed before me, Theodore D. Rand Commissioner of the State of Kentucky in the State of Pennsylvania this 25th day of May, 1865.

figure.ab:
THEO D. RAND
COMMISSIONER OF DEEDS.
PHILADELPHIA,
PENNA.

body.p:
Witness my hand and official seal.
Theo D Rand
Commissioner for Kentucky in Pennsylvania

Comr Deeds
Pennsylvania
Oath of
H. W. Tener
filed
30th May 1865
